root.TEXT:
Record date: 2072-01-01
EDVISIT^84091519^THOMAS-YOSEF, JULIA^01/01/72^HOFFMAN, VICTOR
Seen by me along with Dr. Ickes on 01/01/2072. History as
documented by Dr. Ickes was reviewed by me with the patient and
found to be accurate and complete. The physical exam was
confirmed by my examination. Evaluation and management was also
concurred with.
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: In brief, this is a 51-year-old
woman with history of coronary artery disease status post MI
stenting in 2068, presents with 3-day history of substernal chest
pain radiating to her back, and also complaining of mild pain of
inner medial aspect of her right arm, feels like her anginal
symptoms that she had in 2068 with some very mild shortness of
breath and even though she is quite sedentary and she noted that
there is an increase in pain with exertion, position, as well as
eating. She took many Tums with no relief and says takes Zantac
chronically, but ran out of it. She says that the pain is
burning epigastric at times, and the thing that is concerning was
her back pain that was reminiscent of the pain that she had when
she had her MI.
PAST MEDICAL HISTORY: She has a history of hypertension,
diabetes, MI, and breast cancer status post lumpectomy and
radiation. Last stress test was may be in October, which was
normal.
FAMILY HISTORY: Positive for breast cancer and diabetes
mellitus.
SOCIAL HISTORY: She does not drink. She smoked in the past,
quit 15 years ago.
REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: As documented in the chart. Please see notes
for details.
ALLERGIES: As documented in the chart. Please see notes for
details.
MEDICATIONS: As documented in the chart. Please see notes for
details.
PHYSICAL EXAMINATION: Awake, alert, well-developed,
well-nourished woman, and in no apparent distress. Afebrile,
slightly 96.7, pulse 72, respirations 16, blood pressure 124/72,
and O2 saturation 98%. Anicteric sclerae. Mucous membranes are
moist. Neck is supple. Lungs are clear of rales, wheezes, or
rhonchi. Cardiovascular: Regular rate and rhythm. Abdomen is
obese. Bowel sounds normoactive, nontender, and no guarding,
rebound, or rigidity. The skin is intact, warm, and dry. She
has point tenderness over the upper thoracic cage and trace pedal
edema.
LABORATORY DATA: The patient has a normal CBC and normal
electrolytes. D-dimer was less than 200. Troponin and CK were
normal.
IMAGING STUDIES: EKG sinus rhythm with unchanged from previous.
Chest CT was negative PE.
EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT COURSE: As such, she was admitted to the
Observation Unit for a second set of enzymes which if normal will
be discharged home, after walking to see if she has any
exertional component, as such, she was subsequently discharged to
home in stable and satisfactory condition. She was admitted to
the Observation Unit 01/01/2072 with diagnosis of chest pain.
______________________________
HOFFMAN, VICTOR M.D.
D: 01/01/72
T: 01/02/72
Dictated By: HOFFMAN, VICTOR
eScription document:0-5469816 BFFocus
******** Not reviewed by Attending Physician ********
